data.title: No iOS Simulator log output in Cocos v3.9 when running from `cocos run -p ios`
data.body: I'm unable to see any log output created either from `log()` calls or `CCLOG()` calls in my code. When I run the project from XCode the output appears in the XCode output console as expected, but nothing shows up when running the project from the console.

data.title: Comment renderer part
Requested but did not find extension point with identifier Xcode.DVTFoundation.DevicePlatformMapping
data.body:
When running the default new C++ project for iOS in Cocos version 3.9 I get the following warning on startup:

```
2016-01-11 10:07:21.336 ios-sim-xcode6[44756:2591213] [MT] DVTAssertions: Warning in /Library/Caches/com.apple.xbs/Sources/DVTFrameworks/DVTFrameworks-9542/DVTFoundation/PlugInArchitecture/PlugInManager/DVTPlugInManager.m:259
Details:  Requested but did not find extension point with identifier Xcode.DVTFoundation.DevicePlatformMapping
Object:   <DVTPlugInManager: 0x7fc468688500>
Method:   -extensionPointWithIdentifier:
Thread:   <NSThread: 0x7fc468508d20>{number = 1, name = main}
Please file a bug at http://bugreport.apple.com with this warning message and any useful information you can provide.
```

The warning causes me to have to issue Control-C from the terminal to return to a prompt. It may also be blocking the debugging console output as I'm unable to see anything being output.

data.title: Comment 3D part
ClippingNode has wrong performance when adding to UIPageView
data.body: To reproduce this issue, create a sprite added to a pageview, then create a clippingnode use a stencil which has same image file as the sprite, and then add a layercolor to the clippingnode.Finally, add the clippingnode to the sprite. When I add multiple sprites with clippingnode to the pageview, other sprite will disappear except one. Is this wrong way to use clippingnode? I was use cocos2dx-3.6.

data.title: WebSocket refactoring, bug fixes, improvements, and passes most Autobahn Test (The most standard WebSocket Protocol Test).
data.body:
This PR is based on the latest release version of `libwebsockets`, so before merging it, please upgrade `libwebsockets`
## Result

It has passed most of Autobahn Test (The most standard WebSocket Protocol Test).
Please see the result at http://182.254.241.97/runtime-test/websocket-report/index.html
## Changes
### Refactoring
- Adds more callback functions like `onConnectionOpened`, `onConnectionClosed` rather than put all websocket callback in just one `onSocketCallback`, code will be clearer and readable.

``` c++
    int onSocketCallback(struct lws *wsi, int reason, void *user, void *in, ssize_t len);

    void onClientWritable();
    void onClientReceivedData(void* in, ssize_t len);
    void onConnectionOpened();
    void onConnectionError();
    void onConnectionClosed();
```
- Uses `performFunctionInCocosThread(cb);` to send msg to Cocos Thread rather than make a scheduler update
- Uses `LOGD` for outputting log to debugging websocket connections since websocket stuff uses a sub thread. CCLOG isn't threadsafe.
### Bug Fixes
- WebSocket::close should not block Cocos Thread, it should just notify websocket thread to exit. Now the behavior is the same as Browser. To prove, you could type some test code in Chrome and the result will be:

``` javascript
ws = new WebSocket("ws://127.0.0.1:9123"); ws.onclose = function(){ console.log("I'm closed");}; 
(){ console.log("I'm closed");}
console.log("before close"); ws.close(); console.log("hello");
VM437:2 before close
VM437:2 hello
undefined
VM433:2 I'm closed
```
- Fixed every websocket event will cost 50ms at least, since the old way was wrong, we should not wait 50ms in sub thread while loop. `lws_service(xxx, time_to_wait)` will do it for us. So it fixed delay of message receive/send.
- Fixed potential high CPU cost since the old code will trigger a websocket writable event every time after the writable callback. Now only when the size of the sending message queue isn't zero, a `lws_callback_on_writable` will be invoked
- Fixed `libwebsocket_context_destroy` may not be invoked while closing connection.
- Fixed sending large data will trigger websocket errors
- Fixed receiving large data in many frames will trigger JS `onmessage` callback many times
- Fixed `lws_write` may return a smaller value than the value `n` for sending, a `WebSocketFrame` class is doing the job. `data->issued` should not be increased while a `WebSocketFrame` isn't totally sent.
- Fixed connection isn't closed if received text message is an invalid UTF8 string.
- Fixed the memory leak that JSB_WebSocketDelegate is never released.
### Improvements
- Better performance for received data buffer. Uses `std::vector` for dynamic received data buffer, the old way is every time there is a frame received, buffer memory will be extended every time there is a message comes. It was very low performance.
- Supports receive/send data with zero size.
- Larger socket rx/tx buffer size `WS_RX_BUFFER_SIZE` for better performance.
- Adds static method `WebSocket::closeAllConnections`, it should be invoked while resetting `Director`, for ensure all websocket threads exit. Otherwise, cocos will release all engine classes when exiting game, then if a websocket event is coming, it will cause exception since websocket API is asynchronous.

data.title: Merge 3.10 release from v3.10 into v3 branch
update document version and file encoding
ActionTimeline: set tag issue
TextHAlignment::LEFT/RIGHT behave differently on Windows vs. Android with arabic text
data.body:
_Version_
- 3.9

_Problem_

When using ui::Label::createWithSystemFont and assigning arabic text, TextHAlignment::LEFT (or RIGHT) will behave differently on Windows vs. Android.

_Hints_

Seems like the Android implementation resolves the default alignment from the text (left-aligned for latin, right-aligned for arabic), and that TextHAlignment::LEFT/RIGHT therefore mean default and inverse-default, respectively. On Windows, TextHAlignment::LEFT/RIGHT behave as expected.

_Additional_

It may be desirable to have default/inverse-default alignment settings, in addition to left/right, so as not to duplicate some assets solely for language support

data.title: Label with system font on Windows always displays arabic text in a left-to-right context
data.body:
_Version_
- 3.9

_Problem_

When using ui::Label::createWithSystemFont on Windows, and assigning arabic text ending with a period, the period is always displayed at the right end of the text (when it should be on the left end).

_Hints_

I tracked the problem down to the DrawTextW win32 API, which needs an additional flag (DT_RTLREADING) to display text in a right-to-left context. Unfortunately, no cocos2d API exists to specify this.
